Thanks, Kent. I have already heard about the first
way. Can you explain the second? What "small-scale
tests" are?


-----------


--- kentlbeck <kentbeck@...> wrote:
> --- In junit@y..., Boris Garbuzov
> <boris_garbuzov@y...> wrote:
> > Can somebody suggest on some issue of JUnit API
> usage
> > or test case design? Sorry for a long appendix
> code.
> > The essence is that I want to start some
> application
> > once in VM session and run all my test methods
> > afterwards. I could not find sufficient place to
> put
> > my initial call 
> > ClientMain.main (null);
> 
> You can wrap your whole suite in a TestSetup
> subclass that calls 
> ClientMain.main(null); or you can figure out how to
> write small-scale 
> tests. I write smaller scale tests whenever
> possible, and if I think 
> about it hard enough, it's always possible.
> 
> Kent
> 
>
